data.title: The Top 40 Biggest Songs In The UK In 2015
data.meta_description: On charts throughout the music world, it’s all about the top 40. Once a single or an album passes that threshold, it has reached a certain level of success, and while hitting the top ten or even number one is of course much more sought after, the top 40 is [...]
data.text:
On charts throughout the music world, it’s all about the top 40. Once a single or an album passes that threshold, it has reached a certain level of success, and while hitting the top ten or even number one is of course much more sought after, the top 40 is a great place for a piece of music to begin.

Now, having a top 40 hit is great, but what about ending the year as one of the top forty biggest songs? That’s an entirely different level of success. The Official Charts Company—the United Kingdom’s Billboard, essentially—just recently revealed the country’s top forty hits of 2015. Mark Ronson’s unstoppable “Uptown Funk!” is officially the biggest song of 2015 in the UK , followed by OMI’s breakout hit “Cheerleader”. While it may have been released the year prior, Irish rocker Hozier’s worldwide debut “Take Me To Church” comes in at number three, while soundtrack cuts by Ellie Goulding (“Love Me Like You Do”) and Wiz Khalifa (“See You Again”) round out the top five.

While there are plenty of songs that were also commercial winners in this part of the world, there are some tracks that never made it to America on this top forty list. For example, James Bay’s “Hold Back The River”, which places at number eight on the year-end ranking, was a big number one in the UK, but it never made it never made much of an impact here in the States. The same can be said for the handful of hits by British pop acts like Jess Glynne and Years & Years, as well as one-offs by Lost Frequencies, Little Mix, Philip George, and several others. While the two countries may share a lot of culture, there is still quite a bit of music that only gets heard by one side of the ocean.

Here is the full list of the top 40 songs in the UK last year :

1. Mark Ronson - “Uptown Funk! (ft. Bruno Mars)”

2. OMI - “Cheerleader (ft. Felix Jaehn)”

3. Hozier - “Take Me To Church”

4. Ellie Goulding - “Love Me Like You Do”

5. Wiz Khalifa - “See You Again (ft. Charlie Puth)”

6. Adele - “Hello”

7. Major Lazer - “Lean On (ft. DJ Snake and MØ)”

8. James Bay - “Hold Back The River”

9. Justin Bieber - “What Do You Mean?”

10. Justin Bieber - “Sorry”

11. Years & Years - “King”

12. Ed Sheeran - “Thinking Out Loud”

13. Maroon 5 - “Sugar”

14. Jess Glynne - “Hold My Hand”

15. Skrillex & Diplo - “Where Are Ü Now (ft. Justin Bieber)”

16. Jason Derulo - “Want To Want Me”

17. Lost Frequencies - “Are You With Me”

18. Rihanna & Kanye West - “FourFiveSeconds (ft. Paul McCartney)”

19. Walk The Moon - “Shut Up And Dance”

20. Calvin Harris - “How Deep Is Your Love (ft. Disciples)”

21. The Weeknd - “Can’t Feel My Face”

22. Kygo - “Firestone (ft. Conrad Sewell)”

23. Fetty Wap - “Trap Queen”

24. Justin Bieber - “Love Yourself”

25. The Weeknd - “The Hills”

26. The Weeknd - “Earned It (Fifty Shades Of Grey)”

27. Little Mix - “Black Magic”

28. Philip George - “Wish You Were Mine”

29. Ed Sheeran - “Photograph”

30. Avicii - “The Nights”

31. Galantis - “Runaway (U & I)”

32. Sia - “Elastic Heart”

33. Ed Sheeran - “Bloodstream (ft. Rudimental)”

34. Charlie Puth - “Marvin Gaye (ft. Meghan Trainor)”

35. Olly Murs - “Up (ft. Demi Lovato)”

36. Tinie Tempah - “Not Letting Go (ft. Jess Glynne)”

37. Years & Years - “Shine”

38. Chris Brown & Tyga - “Ayo”

39. Jess Glynne - “Don’t Be So Hard On Yourself”

40. Drake - “Hotline Bling”
